desc: SOS1, a RAS activator, is altered at low frequencies in various cancers.

gene.name: SOS Ras/Rac guanine nucleotide exchange factor 1

desc: The SOS1 gene encodes a guanine exchange factor (GEF) that acts as a signal transducer of the MAP-kinase (MAPK) pathway. SOS1 binds GRB2 and facilitates the activated RAS-GTP bound state, which in turn initiates the MAPK pathway signaling cascade (PMID: 8493579). SOS1 also activates RAC by promoting the exchange of GDP for GTP (PMID: 9438849, 22042618). SOS1 mutations are rare events in cancers (PMID: 18064648; cBioPortal, MSKCC, Dec. 2016). However, germline gain-of-function mutations in SOS1 are the cause of certain forms of Noonan syndrome, a hereditary disorder of congenital heart disease (PMID: 17143285, 17143282).

gene.name: SOS Ras/Rac guanine nucleotide exchange factor 1

articles.title: Germline gain-of-function mutations in SOS1 cause Noonan syndrome.
